result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy R. Koenig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to current prison term

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample unless already provided.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  No contact w/females under 18 unless agent approval except own child.  Sex Offender assessment.  Continue child support payments.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy R. Koenig

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy R. Koenig in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Timothy R. Koenig in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:  Dismissed but read in

Count 2:
5 years Probation, Consecutive to current prison term
DNA surcharge $250/sample (already provided sample)
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Sex Offender assesment
Continue with child support payments
NO contact w/females under 18 unless agent approval, except own child
$268.00 C/C  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Timothy R. Koenig in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Timothy R. Koenig in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1
Preliminary hearing on December 12, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on October 17, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Return date on November 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Timothy R. Koenig in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Timothy R. Koenig in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset to 11/5/14.  Bond continues  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on August 29, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Return date on September 10, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Timothy R. Koenig appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Greg Sacra. Prosecuting Atty Kevin R. Calkins appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE qualifies for PD representation.  State requests $5000 Cash and states has similar charges in Richland Co.  Atty.  Sacra makes argument.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  Court sets $5000.00 CASH bond.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/victim GJS (9.3.98); No contact w/any female under the age of 18.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
